meanings.sent1: The unconsolidated sand easily shifted with the wind.
meanings.sent2: The loose, unconsolidated soil made it difficult to build on.
meanings.sent3: The unconsolidated snow caused the kids to slip and slide down the hill.
meanings.sent4: Her unconsolidated thoughts scattered like leaves in the wind.
meanings.sent5: The unconsolidated mixture of ingredients resulted in a lumpy texture.

meanings.definition: Not combined into a single unit or entity.
meanings.sent1: The unconsolidated group of students had trouble working together.
meanings.sent2: The unconsolidated data points did not provide a clear picture.
meanings.sent3: The unconsolidated puzzle pieces were scattered all over the table.
meanings.sent4: Her unconsolidated ideas floated around without a clear direction.
meanings.sent5: The unconsolidated collection of books cluttered the room.

meanings.sent1: The unconsolidated company struggled to stay afloat.
meanings.sent2: The unconsolidated economy faced uncertainty and fluctuations.
meanings.sent3: His unconsolidated spending habits left him in debt.
meanings.sent4: The unconsolidated investments led to unexpected losses.
meanings.sent5: The unconsolidated budget caused stress and worry.
